meanings.definition: Difficult to handle or manage due to size, weight, or complexity.
meanings.sent1: The unwieldiest box was too heavy for the little girl to lift.
meanings.sent2: Moving the unwieldiest furniture in the room required extra help.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle all those unwieldiest books, she ended up dropping them all.
meanings.sent4: The unwieldiest task of organizing the garage felt like moving a mountain.
meanings.sent5: The unwieldiest backpack she ever carried made her shoulders ache for days.

meanings.definition: Awkward or clumsy in movement or action.
meanings.sent1: He felt unwieldiest when trying to dance in front of a crowd.
meanings.sent2: The puppy looked unwieldiest as it tried to climb the stairs for the first time.
meanings.sent3: Her unwieldiest attempt at juggling oranges made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The unwieldiest robot on the dance floor moved in jerky, robotic motions.
meanings.sent5: The unwieldiest clown at the circus kept tripping over his own oversized shoes.
